direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are part of the standard Object class and are often tested together to ensure consistent behavior.
Both methods provide information about the object's state, which can be useful for testing object equality and representation.
The equals method relies on the internal Random object, and testing it with different Random instances can enhance coverage.
Both methods handle invalid input (e.g., non-positive bounds) and can be tested for consistent exception handling.
Both methods access and manipulate internal resources (e.g., Random instance, hex arrays) and can be tested for consistent resource handling.
